channel.title: Posts on Boyoon's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Boyoon's blog

item.title: Comprehension
item.description: Comprehensions take similar to for loop except that it can be expressed into a single line. For example, below will iterate the process of summing three variables that takes different integer in a range of 1 and 3. This will produce 27 different cases each of which will be stored in 3x3x3 array. [ i + j + k for i=1:3, j=1:3, k=1:3 ] Output: 3×3×3 Array{Int64, 3}: [:, :, 1] = 3 4 5 4 5 6 5 6 7 [:, :, 2] = 4 5 6 5 6 7 6 7 8 [:, :, 3] = 5 6 7 6 7 8 7 8 9

item.title: Optimization Using Julia
item.description: This post is about optimization using Julia

item.title: What job might not be replaceable by AI?
item.description: This post explores jobs that might be hard to be replaced by AI

item.title: For loop, RData, filter, and wsample in Julia
item.description: This post is using for loop, importing R object into Julia, using filter to DataFrame-type-object, using wsample to draw values from known probability distribution

item.title: Basics of Julia
item.description: This post is about basics of Julia. This is an exercise before running the simulation for my job market paper using Julia
